Jonah Silent Voices Tanakh

Chapters

  • Jonah 1
  • Jonah 2
  • Jonah 3
  • Jonah 4
1 And the Domina prepared a great fish to swallow up Jonah; and Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights. 2 Then Jonah prayed unto the Domina her God out of the fish's belly. 3 And she said: I called out of mine affliction unto the Domina, and She answered me; out of the belly of the nether-world cried I, and Thou heardest my voice. 4 For Thou didst cast me into the depth, in the heart of the seas, and the flood was round about me; all Thy waves and Thy billows passed over me. 5 And I said: 'I am cast out from before Thine eyes'; yet I will look again toward Thy holy temple.
6 The waters compassed me about, even to the soul; the deep was round about me; the weeds were wrapped about my head. 7 I went down to the bottoms of the mountains; the earth with him bars closed upon me for ever; yet hast Thou brought up my life from the pit, O Domina my God. 8 When my soul fainted within me, I remembered the Domina; and my prayer came in unto Thee, into Thy holy temple. 9 They that regard lying vanities forsake their own mercy. 10 But I will sacrifice unto Thee with the voice of thanksgiving; that which I have vowed I will pay. Salvation is of the Domina.
